content: teeny tiny pumpkins yarn - fingering 4ply/weight 1 main color approx 6 yards for smallest size stem color less than a yard height may vary little big see tips section for this larger size gauge doesn t matter seriously needles 2 25mm us 1/uk 13 dpns notions removable stitch marker yarn needle fluffy stuffing optional twig and/or floral wire for stem instructions using main pumpkin color and leaving a 4 or so tail cast on 6 stiches using the long tail cast on method distribute stitches evenly across 3 needles and join for working in the round round 1 kfb all 12 sts round 2 kfb all 24 sts round 3 k2 p2 repeat to end round 4 kfb-m k1 p2 repeat to end 30 sts place bor marker rounds 5-11 k3 p2 repeat to end 7 rounds round 12 k2tog k1 p2 repeat to end 24 sts round 13 k2 p2 repeat to end round 14 k2tog p2tog repeat to end 12 sts round 15 k2tog all 6 sts cut yarn leaving a 6 or longer tail if not knitting a stem thread tail on to a yarn needle and take through remaining live stitches do not pull tight yet to allow room to stuff stuff with a small amount of fluffy stuffing at this point whether you are knitting the stem or not optional stem optional round 16 join stem color and k2tog to end - 3 sts arrange all remaining sts on to a single needle note you can do this as you knit round 16 tie pumpkin yarn to stem yarn tightly optional rounds 17-19 k as icord cut yarn leaving a 4 or so tail thread on to a yarn needle and take through remaining live stitches from right to left weave in both ends of stem color taking top tail end of pumpkin colored yarn thread on to a yarn needle plunge needle in through the top and out through the bottom center there should be a little hole there from the cast on pulling this yarn in will shape your pumpkin tie this end to the cast on tail tightly to maintain desired shape keep in mind how strong your yarn is when pulling tightly as some yarn breaks more easily than others tips a chopstick can be very useful to get the stuffing through the small opening to make the larger pumpkin increase repeating row starting at round 5 to 10 row instead of 7 the amount of stuffing you use will impact the size and shape of your pumpkin to use a stick scavenged from the great outdoors as your stem skip rounds 16-19 simply cut a twig a little taller than your pumpkin and poke it through the top either side of the pumpkin can be used at this point for your top according to your preference the curly stem part was made by wrapping a bit of wire around a toothpick this pattern can be easily sized up to
